intro: Phyteuma urticifolium, commonly known as the stinging nettle phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, often resembling those of stinging nettle. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant blooms from late spring to early summer, producing showy purple or pink flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
